item.title: About Call Center Features
item.description:
Overview of LiveAgent Call Center Features link

What is the Call Center Feature link

The LiveAgent call center feature is an integrated customer service system that dramatically transforms corporate phone support. It provides a next-generation customer support foundation that consolidates everything from traditional simple phone switching to customer information management, automatic routing, and quality control.

The Need for Enhanced Phone Support link

Even in the age of email and live chat, many customers, including younger generations, continue to prefer calling companies. This is because customers want to speak directly to resolve complex issues or urgent matters.

item.title: Automatic Callback
item.description:
Overview of Automatic Callback link

Automatic Callback is a feature that eliminates the need for customers to wait continuously during busy periods and automatically calls them back when their turn comes. It reduces long hold times and frustration while providing a smooth customer experience.

Benefits of Automatic Callback link

Improved Customer Experience link

Many call centers have customers waiting anywhere from several minutes to tens of minutes. By implementing automatic callback, customers are freed from the “stress of continuous waiting” and can receive responses at the appropriate timing.

item.title: Call Button
item.description:
What is a Call Button link

A call button that can be installed on websites, allowing customers to directly call support with one click. It bridges the gap with online visitors and enables instant communication.

Benefits and Use Cases link

For example, when installed on an e-commerce product page, customers can immediately ask operators questions while considering a purchase. Since responses are faster than inquiry forms or emails, this directly leads to improved conversion rates.

item.title: Call Detail Records
item.description:
Call Detail Records Overview link

A feature that records all information related to calls (call duration, caller, recipient, transfer history, etc.). Useful for analysis, auditing, and improvements.

Improving Support Quality link

Support managers can understand agent response times and resolution rates based on recorded data. This allows them to adjust training policies and continuously improve customer service quality.

Troubleshooting and Legal Response link

Additionally, when issues arise, records can be referenced for fact-checking and providing legal evidence.

item.title: Call Device Scheduling
item.description:
Overview of Call Device Scheduling link

A feature that allows scheduling of devices used for calls. It enables flexible switching based on business hours and staff availability.

Usage Examples link

For example, you can set up configurations such as using an office desk phone in the morning and a home softphone in the afternoon. This makes it easier to accommodate remote work and shift work arrangements.

Benefits for Companies link

For companies with multiple locations or remote work arrangements, the ability to build a stable customer service system is a significant advantage.

item.title: Call Routing
item.description:
What is Call Routing link

Call routing is a function that routes incoming calls from customers to the most suitable agents or departments. It automatically processes calls based on skills, availability, and priority.

Specific Routing Examples link

For example, technical questions are routed to the support department, while billing-related questions are directed to the accounting team. This reduces the effort required for first-level response and allows customers to connect with the appropriate representative in the shortest time possible.

item.title: Call Transfers
item.description:
Overview of Transfer Functionality link

Call transfer is an important feature that enables seamless transfer of ongoing calls to other agents or departments.

Types of Transfer Methods link

You can choose between “warm transfer (with prior explanation)” or “blind transfer (immediate transfer)” as needed.

For example, when a customer’s inquiry involves a specialized field, an agent can briefly explain the situation before handing it over to the appropriate person. This eliminates the need for customers to wastefully repeat the same explanation.

item.title: Can I use my current phone number?
item.description:
Using Phone Numbers with LiveAgent link

Basics of SIP Trunk and Number Integration link

Using your current phone number with LiveAgent is only possible if that number supports SIP trunk. LiveAgent’s call center functionality operates by connecting numbers from VoIP (Voice Over Internet Protocol) providers that support SIP (Session Initiation Protocol) trunks.

Important Limitations link

  • LiveAgent does not provide or sell phone numbers
  • Regular phone numbers that do not support SIP trunk cannot be integrated
  • You need to purchase a number from a VoIP provider and obtain SIP connection information

item.title: Internal Calls
item.description:
Overview of Internal Calls link

Internal calls are a feature that allows agents to make direct calls with each other within the system. This enables quick confirmation during customer service and efficient internal communication.

The Need for Internal Calls link

In support environments, there are many situations where agents need to confirm information with other team members to respond to customer requests. Internal calls allow for faster and more reliable information sharing compared to chat or email.

item.title: IVR (Interactive Voice Response: Automatic Voice Response)
item.description:
Basic Concepts of IVR link

Definition of IVR link

IVR (Interactive Voice Response) is a telephone system that automatically interacts with customers who call. It is also called an “automatic voice response system.”

IVR systems respond by collecting information during the interaction process and executing appropriate actions (such as transferring to the right representative or department, performing callbacks, etc.).

How IVR Works link

When customers want to contact a support team, they hear pre-recorded voice guidance and can be instantly redirected to the appropriate support team department by simply entering voice or keypad commands.

item.title: Making and Receiving Phone Calls with LiveAgent
item.description:
Overview of LiveAgent’s Phone Features link

The voice support service realized with LiveAgent includes two types:

  • Phone calls using Twilio, a cloud-based IP phone service
  • Browser-based voice conversations

Customers can make calls through regular phone numbers or initiate calls from buttons on websites. To use phone and voice conversation features, audio devices (microphone, speakers, headset, etc.) that can be connected to a PC are required.

Related Topics: Using voice call service “Twilio”, Using PC-to-PC voice conversations

item.title: Softphones
item.description:
What is a Softphone link

A softphone is a system that enables phone calls through apps on PCs or smartphones. No dedicated phone equipment is required - only an internet connection is needed.

Key Features link

It is ideal for remote work and telecommuting environments, enabling customer service regardless of location. It also offers flexibility for easy integration with other business tools.

It contributes to cost reduction and is particularly popular among small and medium-sized enterprises due to its ease of implementation.

item.title: Supported Call Devices
item.description:
LiveAgent Device Support Overview link

LiveAgent is a flexible communication tool that supports a wide variety of call devices.

Supported Devices link

  • Desk phones
  • Headsets
  • Softphones

Benefits link

Cost Optimization link

Companies can utilize their existing equipment as-is, enabling system implementation while minimizing new investments. Flexible options significantly lower the implementation barriers.

Flexible Operations link

Customer support can also select optimal devices according to usage scenarios, ensuring stable quality is maintained.

item.title: Unlimited Call Recordings
item.description:
Overview of Unlimited Call Recording link

LiveAgent’s call recording feature provides a system that can store all calls without limits. This is an essential function for improving support quality, educational purposes, and compliance requirements.

Main Benefits of Call Recording link

Agent Training and Quality Improvement link

Recording data can be used for training purposes, allowing agents to review past conversations and identify areas for improvement.

Troubleshooting and Evidence Preservation link

In case of disputes with customers, recordings can be presented as evidence.

item.title: Video Chat
item.description:
Video Chat Overview link

Video chat is a feature that enables agents and customers to engage in real-time video calls. It complements information that is difficult to convey through voice alone, providing more personal and trustworthy support.

Benefits and Use Cases link

Intuitive Information Transfer link

For example, when explaining how to use complex products, agents can demonstrate operation procedures on screen while providing explanations, allowing customers to understand intuitively. Additionally, emotions and nuances can be conveyed through facial expressions, making it possible to bridge the distance with customers.
